alert.note: Alert for Heard; Meriwether; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Meriwether, southern Heard, Troup and southwestern Coweta Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Wares Crossroads, or near LaGrange, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... LaGrange, Franklin, Hogansville, Grantville, Luthersville, Lone Oak, Corinth, Saint Marks, Mountville, Cannonville, Louise, Abbottsford, Harrisonville, Hillcrest, Big Springs, Wares Crossroads, Glenn, and Long Cane. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
